'Trained engineer': Venezuela's Machado wins Nobel Peace Prize - what’s her academic background?
description: María Corina Machado, a Venezuelan industrial engineer and opposition leader, has won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for her relentless fight for democracy against authoritarian rule. Her journey from academia to activism reflects a fusion of technical precision and civic courage. Founder of Súmate and leader of Vente Venezuela, Machado has endured persecution, exile, and political bans. Her engineering mindset underpins her approach to governance, showing that democracy, like any system, requires constant, principled maintenance.

Yashasvi Jaiswal scripts history, joins elite list of cricket legends
description: Yashasvi Jaiswal's magnificent century dominated the opening day against the West Indies, propelling India to a commanding position. His seventh Test hundred before 24 places him among cricketing legends. Jaiswal's consistent opening prowess outshines all others since his debut, solidifying his status as a rising star.

description: The Labour Minister said the Karnataka government’s unanimous decision to give a 12-day paid menstrual leave a year would greatly benefit women working in garment and other small industries.

description: The suite of services is similar to Google’s Gemini Enterprise targeted at daily business users which was also unveiled on the same day

description: India had closed its Embassy in Kabul after the Taliban seized power following the withdrawal of U.S.-led NATO forces in 2021, but opened a technical mission a year later

title: Trump seeks fair play! US asks China to not fly over Russia
description: The US government has proposed barring Chinese airlines from flying over Russia on routes to and from the United States, citing unfair competitive advantages. This move aims to level the playing field for American carriers, which lost access to Russian airspace after the Ukraine invasion. The proposal could impact major Chinese airlines and adds to existing US-China economic tensions.

title: U.S. Senate unanimously endorses repeal of 2002 Iraq war resolution
description: U.S. Senate votes to repeal 2003 invasion resolution, ending war in Iraq and asserting Congress’s authority over military conflicts

description: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), rainfall recorded on October 9 evening was 5.1 mm at HAL Airport, 3.6 mm at Kempegowda International Airport, and 9.5 mm at the KSNDMC campus.

title: Supreme Court urges Centre to honour its ‘solemn promise’ on restoring J&K Statehood
description: A Bench headed by the Chief Justice directed Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the Centre, to file a response within four weeks

title: NCSC seeks report on ‘caste bias’ allegations following Haryana IPS officer’s death
description: The Commission, in the notice issued on Thursday (October 9, 2025), said that it had taken suo motu cognizance of media reports about the suicide note and had decided to investigate the issue

Ex-cricketer tears into selectors for snubbing Samson from ODIs - Watch
description: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticized the selection committee for overlooking Sanju Samson in favor of Dhruv Jurel for the Australia ODI series. Kaif argued Samson's consistent middle-order performance and prowess against spin make him a better fit for Australian conditions, questioning the focus on recent form over sustained ability.

title: ‘If Yuvraj Singh hands his kids over to me, they will meet same fate as he did’: Yograj Singh reveals why they don’t get along
Watch: Protests erupt over Telangana HC stay on backward classes reservation
Bengaluru pub: Bank manager found dead inside ladies' washroom
description: A 31-year-old bank manager was found dead in a pub's ladies' washroom in Bengaluru under suspicious circumstances. Megharaj, who had consumed alcohol and food with friends, reportedly felt unwell and entered the washroom before being discovered unconscious. The cause of death is pending post-mortem and forensic analysis.

title: 18-year-old cadet found dead at NDA; Pune police suspect suicide

Lenskart to launch UPI-integrated smartglasses
description: Lenskart said that users can complete transactions by scanning a QR code with their smartglasses

title: Priyansh named in Delhi’s Ranji squad for first game
description: Batter Yash Dhull has been named as the vice-captain. The squad features left-hand batter Priyansh Arya, who has impressed in the white-ball formats but is yet to play a First-Class game for Delhi

title: IPL 2026 auction: Likely to take place in December; set to be staged in India
description: IPL 2026 mini-auction is set for December 13-15, with franchises submitting retention lists by November 15. The auction might return to India after overseas editions. Several high-profile players, including Sam Curran and Devon Conway, are reportedly being considered for release. Australian all-rounder Cameron Green is expected to be a major draw.

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea on cough syrup deaths
description: The petitioner said ‘precious time’ was passing without any substantial steps taken in the investigation by the States

title: Karwa Chauth 2025 Moonrise Timings Today Live Updates: City-wise Moonrise Timings Today, Vrat Katha  Puja Muhurat, Vidhi, Karwa Chauth Wishes, and more
Hit by EU sanctions over Russia oil - India's Nayara struggles to sustain
description: Nayara Energy, a major Indian refinery with significant Russian ownership, is navigating EU sanctions by boosting domestic fuel distribution via increased rail transport. The company, now solely sourcing crude from Russia, faces challenges securing export markets and processing international payments.

title: 'Committed to sovereignty': Jaishankar meets Afghan FM; India to reopen embassy in Kabul
description: India is upgrading its Technical Mission in Kabul to an embassy, signaling a renewed commitment to Afghanistan's sovereignty and regional stability. External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted cooperation in mining and trade, while Afghanistan's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi pledged not to allow Afghan territory for anti-India activities, emphasising mutual respect and people-to-people ties.

title: SIT to file report on Sabarimala ‘gold theft’ in 6 weeks: Kerala High Court
Mohammed Shami, Akash Deep in strong Bengal squad for Ranji Trophy opener
Cough syrup deaths: SC rejects PIL seeking CBI probe, drug safety review; toll at 21 in MP
description: The Supreme Court has dismissed a plea for a CBI investigation into the deaths of children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. These deaths were reportedly caused by a toxic cough syrup. The manufacturer's owner has been arrested. Several states have banned the syrup, and the factory has been sealed.

title: Kerala Tourism marks John Lennon’s 85th birthday with ‘Imagine’-inspired post celebrating peace
description: A picture featuring five women artistes clad in the traditional attire of three religious art forms and crossing a road with the tagline ‘Imagine/ all the people/ livin’ life in peace’ reminds netizens of John Lennon’s message about peace

title: 'Traffic means growth': Priyank Kharge's bizarre justification for Bengaluru jams
description: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge views Bengaluru's traffic congestion as a positive indicator of economic growth, attributing it to the city's booming job market and influx of migrants. He highlighted significant office space absorption and a large vehicle count, suggesting these are symptoms of a thriving economy that needs to be managed.

title: ‘Speak Kannada’: Woman accuses Bengaluru Uber driver of abusing her
description: A woman in Bengaluru alleged an Uber auto driver abused her and attempted to hit her, claiming the driver demanded she speak Kannada and took videos during the confrontation. The incident occurred after she cancelled a ride, with the driver later blocking her path and demanding money, stating she was being targeted due to her Northeast origin.

title: India’s most employable graduates in 2025: MBAs first; engineers a close second
description: According to the India Skills Report 2025 by Wheebox, MBA graduates are India’s most employable at 78%, followed by B.Tech (71.5%) and MCA (71%). The national employability rate stands at 54.81%, with rising demand for business, technology, and IT expertise. The report highlights upskilling, adaptability, and a blend of technical and human skills as key to job readiness.

description: Jasprit Bumrah has achieved a significant milestone. He is now the first Indian fast bowler to participate in 50 matches across all three formats of the game. This achievement follows his recent record as the fastest Indian bowler to claim 50 home Test wickets.

title: Almost 14 foot: Largest great white shark recorded in Atlantic resurfaces - Video
description: A colossal 14-foot male great white shark, named Contender, has journeyed from Florida to the northern Gulf of St. Lawrence. This 1,653-pound giant, the largest male tagged by OCEARCH in the western North Atlantic, is likely drawn by abundant seal and fish populations. Researchers are tracking its extensive migration patterns.

Mysterious explosions in Kabul: Did Pak carry out airstrike? Here’s what we know
description: Explosions rocked Kabul late Thursday night, causing panic. This follows an incident where the Pakistani military killed 30 militants. These militants were responsible for the deaths of nine soldiers and two officials in Balochistan. The Pakistani army claims India's involvement in the Balochistan attack. Investigations into the Kabul blasts are ongoing.

description: Raja Jackson, son of UFC legend Rampage Jackson, has pleaded not guilty to felony battery charges following a violent assault on pro-wrestler Syko Stu. The incident, which occurred at an independent wrestling event, resulted in Stu sustaining serious injuries. Jackson faces potential imprisonment, with a preliminary hearing scheduled.

Sister Jean’s cause of death: Loyola-Chicago chaplain legend passes at 106
description: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, Loyola University Chicago's cherished chaplain, has passed away at 106. She gained global fame during the 2018 basketball team's Final Four run.  Sister Jean provided spiritual guidance and mentorship for decades. Her legacy extends beyond sports, encompassing a memoir and community programs.  She was a symbol of hope and faith for many.

UP murder: Ex-boyfriend slits woman's throat; arrested after encounter
description: Kaushambi police have arrested Balbeer Singh Patel for the murder of a woman in Sirathu, whose throat was slit. Singh, the victim's former lover, was apprehended after an encounter where he fired at police and was shot in the leg. The murder weapon, a motorcycle, and the victim's phone were recovered.

Bihar polls: 17 EBC, 11 OBC, 9 general, 7 Muslims in Jan Suraaj's 1st list
description: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj party unveiled its first 51 candidates for Bihar polls, prioritizing individuals from non-political backgrounds. The list features doctors, academics, retired officers, a singer, and Karpoori Thakur's granddaughter, aiming to offer a fresh alternative. Caste equations were considered, with representation from EBC, OBC, general, and Muslim communities, alongside women and a transgender candidate.

India vs West Indies in 1948: Throwback to 1st ever Test in New Delhi, where Clyde Walcott and Everton Weekes were unleashed
Russell Wilson benched vs Eagles: Giants QB’s emotional message to wife Ciara
description: The New York Giants have benched veteran quarterback Russell Wilson for Jaxson Dart in their Week 6 game against the Eagles, marking Wilson's third consecutive game on the sidelines due to performance issues. Despite professional challenges, Wilson finds strength in his family, including wife Ciara and their children, and remains ready to contribute if called upon.

title: 'Priya Kapur behaving like Cinderella's stepmother': What Karisma's kids told HC
description: In a Delhi High Court inheritance battle, Sunjay Kapur's children from ex-wife Karisma Kapoor accused his current wife, Priya Kapur, of behaving like "Cinderella's stepmother" and usurping assets. They allege Priya presented a forged will to secure a larger share of the Rs 30,000 crore estate, putting the children in danger.

title: Noida horror: Man kills dhaba worker who refused to pack late-night food order
description: A dhaba worker was beaten to death in Gaur City-2 after a dispute over late-night food orders. Police have arrested one of the main accused, Kaushal Mishra, following a tip-off. The incident occurred when the trio, allegedly drunk, argued with staff after being refused service. Efforts are underway to apprehend the third accomplice.

title: Jodhpur varsity students get 137 out of 100; results withdrawn
description: MBM Engineering University in Jodhpur has withdrawn BE II semester results. Students received marks exceeding the maximum possible in practical and sessional papers. The university cited a technical error by the agency responsible for online result preparation. Corrected results are expected soon. Approximately 800 students appeared for the exam held in May.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
description: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: McDavid faces backlash for blunt comments on young players after extension
description: Connor McDavid has signed a two-year, $25 million extension with the Edmonton Oilers, accepting below-market value to prioritize winning now.  His decision reflects the team's limited youth due to past trades, creating a tight window for a Stanley Cup.  General Manager Stan Bowman highlighted McDavid's team-first approach, emphasizing the immediate goal of championship contention.
